item.title: Pixel Pal (PART 2) : Gathering data for Pixel Pal
item.description: Pixel Pal is a project I have started whose purpose is to bring new life to old icon themes. Many old icon themes are in raster format and are not available for HiDPI screens (their resolution are too small). Currently the only way to handle old icon themes is to …
item.dc:creator: Michal Parusinski

item.title: Pixel Pal (PART 1) : Adapting old icon themes for HiDPI screens
item.description: I am starting a new open source project. The goal of this project is to solve a recurring issue with HiDPI support. The issues is that many old software rely on icon themes in raster format which are not suitable for HiDPI screens. To be more specific various software projects …
item.dc:creator: Michal Parusinski

item.title: Snaps, Flatpaks, AppImage which one is ahead?
item.description: On the Linux desktop there is a push for a universal packaging format. Currently there are three main contenders: Snaps packages, promoted by Canonical and Ubuntu; Flatpak, promoted by the Gnome Foundation although not a Gnome project; and AppImage, a community-led project. Even though the three packaging formats differ technically …
item.dc:creator: michalparusinski

item.title: What to learn from the Cambridge Analytica story
item.description: If you are using Facebook and intend to keep using it the Cambridge Analytica story can teach a few good practices to protect your privacy. Now of course nothing will be as safe as not having a Facebook account but there are sensible steps. Also I won't mention typical security …

item.title: New blog | Nouveau blog
item.description:
Hello, for 2018 I am restarting my blog from scratch. In part because in the transition from Wordpress to Pelican and because of my own silly mistakes I lost a lot of content.

Bonjour, pour 2018 je recommence mon blog à partir de zéro. En partie parce que durant la …
